summary: This document outlines the decision-making procedures and voting requirements for a committee associated with Deutsche Bank. It details quorum requirements, majority voting rules, veto rights of the Chairperson, and procedures in the event of a tie. The content appears to be internal governance guidelines rather than directly related to the Epstein case.
keyFacts: The document specifies that no decisions shall be made without a quorum being reached.
Decisions require a qualified majority of 67% to be approved.
The Chairperson has veto rights over decisions until the minutes are finalized.
Procedures for tie situations are not applicable as decisions require a qualified majority or unanimity.
The document is marked as confidential and for internal use only.
